required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sustainable East Africa Research in Community Health
clinical_study.official_title: Sustainable East Africa Research in Community Health

collaborator.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)
United States President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief

brief_summary.textblock: The SEARCH study aims to test evidenced-based innovative community based interventions that lead to the elimination of HIV in rural communities in East Africa using a multi-disease approach. The first phase of the study will quantify the health, economic and educational impact of early HIV diagnosis using a streamlined and immediate ART (antiretroviral therapy). This first phase will be completed in July 2017. The second phase of the study, will quantify the health, economic and educational impact of targeted Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP), targeted HIV testing and targeted care interventions in the context of universal treatment and streamlined care. This second phase will be completed in July 2020. The study intervention is designed to improve the entire continuum of care, to reduce structural barriers for all populations including those most "at risk".

detailed_description.textblock: The SEARCH study aims to test evidenced-based innovative community based interventions that lead to the elimination of HIV in rural communities in East Africa using a multi-disease approach. The first phase of the study will quantify the health, economic and educational impact of early HIV diagnosis using a streamlined and immediate ART (antiretroviral therapy). This first phase will be completed in July 2017. The second phase of the study, will quantify the health, economic and educational impact of targeted Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP), targeted HIV testing and targeted care interventions in the context of universal treatment and streamlined care. This second phase will be completed in July 2020. The study intervention is designed to improve the entire continuum of care, to reduce structural barriers for all populations including those most "at risk". Primary endpoint for the first and second phase is HIV incidence measured 3 years follow up.

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative 3 year HIV incidence in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase I intervention.
Cumulative 3 year HIV incidence in men and women ages ≥15 years after the start of Phase II intervention (started after 3 years of Phase I).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from diagnosis to AIDS
secondary_outcome.description: To compare time from diagnosis to AIDS between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of AIDS-defining events between the study arms
secondary_outcome.description: To compare incidence of AIDS-defining events between the study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total TB and incident TB cases associated with HIV
secondary_outcome.description: TTo compare proportion of total TB and incident TB cases associated with HIV between the study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall mortality
secondary_outcome.description: To compare mortality between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal and child mortality
secondary_outcome.description: To compare number of maternal and child deaths between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mother to child HIV transmission
secondary_outcome.description: To compare mother to child HIV transmission between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Population HIV RNA metrics
secondary_outcome.description: To compare population HIV RNA metrics between the 2 study arms. HIV metrics include: % with HIV viral suppression; median population HIV RNA level; % HIV RNA by strata i.e. greater than 100,000 vs. <100,000 copies/ml

secondary_outcome.measure: Association between population HIV RNA metrics and HIV incidence
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the association between population HIV RNA metrics and HIV incidence. HIV metrics include: % with HIV viral suppression; median population HIV RNA level; % HIV RNA by strata i.e. greater than 100,000 vs. <100,000 copies/ml

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of transmitted HIV drug-resistance mutations
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the prevalence (number of participants with) of transmitted HIV drug-resistance mutations and pharmacologic measures of ART between the study arms after 3 and 6 years of follow up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rates of linkage to and retention in care for HIV
secondary_outcome.description: To compare rates of linkage to and retention in care for HIV between the study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to ART-initiation
secondary_outcome.description: To compare time to ART-initiation between the study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to CD4 cell count recovery in Phase I of high CD4 count individuals (CD4>350)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to CD4 cell count recovery above 350 after enrollment

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of virologic suppression in Phase I of high CD4 count individuals (CD4>350)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to viral load measurements below detectable

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-associated toxicities and grade 3 and 4 adverse events in Phase I of high CD4 count individuals (CD4>350)
secondary_outcome.description: DAIDS toxicity table symptoms grade 3 or 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of HIV drug resistant mutations after 1 and 2 years of treatment in Phase I of high CD4 count individuals (CD4>350)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with HIV drug resistant mutations measured after 1 and 2 years of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative incidence of internally derived HIV infections
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the 3 and 6 year cumulative incidence of internally derived HIV infections (infections genetically linked to a prior infection among members of the same community) between the study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate attitudes of community, patients and providers on care delivery in control and intervention communities
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate attitudes of community, patients and providers on care delivery in control and intervention communities using qualitative focus group interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate implementation of other disease care cascades (hypertension, diabetes, women and children health services)
secondary_outcome.description: Uptake of testing, linkage to care and retention to care

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of complications of diabetes, hypertension and chronic kidney disease (CKD) and to understand the genetic susceptibility of diseases in the study populations.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with of complications of diabetes, hypertension and chronic kidney disease (CKD) and to understand the genetic susceptibility of diseases in the study populations in Phase II.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence to PrEP treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients who adherence to PrEP treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in attitudes towards PrEP
secondary_outcome.description: Qualitative focus group discussions on attitudes toward PrEP

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in average levels of adults' on- and off-farm employment
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of adults' on- and off-farm employment between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in average levels of children's on- and off-farm employment
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of children's on- and off-farm employment (child labor) between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in average levels of children's time allocation to schooling and household activities
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of children's time allocation to schooling and household activities between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in average asset holdings
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average asset holdings (durable good and livestock) between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in agricultural output and other economic production
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in agricultural output and other economic production, such as fishing, between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in average levels of cash and in-kind transfers
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the trends in average levels of cash and in-kind transfers between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total costs of programming
secondary_outcome.description: To compare costs of programming (campaigns, ART) and PrEP (Phase II only) between the study arms: overall; per person identified, linked to care, and started on ART; and per ART-month, CD4 level recovered, and viral load suppressed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in disease burden
secondary_outcome.description: To compare disease burden (expressed in disability adjusted life years, DALYs) between the 2 study arms, during and modelled beyond the study period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Savings from averted disease associated treatment costs
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the savings from averted disease associated treatment costs between the 2 study arms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and consequences of false positive HIV diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: To compare the occurrence and consequences of false positive (new) HIV diagnosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost-effectiveness of the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: To calculate the incremental cost-effectiveness of the intervention, as net cost per DALY averted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate streamlined care of HIV patients
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate streamlined vs. non-streamlined care including time and motion studies for staff and clients (Phase I only).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants in targeted PrEP vs. country standard PrEP
secondary_outcome.description: Numbers of participants who accept targeted linkage for PrEP, retention of PrEP treatment, and suppression interventions including time in motion studies for staff and clients (Phase II only).

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence to PREP
secondary_outcome.description: To compare adherence (proportion of persons starting PrEP who follow-up at routine PrEP visits and proportion of persons with detectable tenofovir in plasma or hair samples) among persons receiving clinic vs community-based delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Linkage to care defined as proportion of persons attending an HIV clinic visit by 30 days after HIV test
secondary_outcome.description: To compare linkage to care with or without a phone call from clinic

secondary_outcome.measure: Linkage to care defined as proportion of persons attending an HIV clinic visit by 30 days after HIV test among adolescents
secondary_outcome.description: To compare linkage to compare among adolescents with or without adolescent navigator

secondary_outcome.measure: HIV incidence rate
secondary_outcome.description: To compare HIV incidence rates between base-line and follow-up year 3

arm_group.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade
arm_group.description: Intervention arm first phase: annual universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART for all HIV+ using streamlined care delivery Intervention arm second phase: baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART for all HIV+ using streamlined care delivery + targeted PrEP, targeted HIV testing, and targeted care interventions

arm_group.arm_group_label: 1st: baseline community testing; 2nd: universal test & treat
arm_group.description: Intervention arm first phase: baseline community-based HIV and multi-disease testing Intervention arm second: baseline universal community-based HIV and multi-disease testing; ART for all HIV+ using streamlined care delivery

intervention.intervention_name: Universal ART in a streamlined care model
intervention.description: immediate ART start for all HIV+ in community with streamlined care
intervention.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade
1st: baseline community testing; 2nd: universal test & treat

intervention.description: HIV and multi-disease testing for all community members
intervention.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade

intervention.intervention_name: Targeted PrEP, Targeted testing, and Targeted care interventions
intervention.arm_group_label: 1st: universal test and treat; 2nd: targeted PrEP and cascade

intervention.intervention_name: Baseline community-based HIV and multi-disease testing
intervention.description: HIV and multi-disease testing for all community members at baseline only
intervention.arm_group_label: 1st: baseline community testing; 2nd: universal test & treat

criteria.textblock:
Community Level Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-adjacent geopolitical units in south-western and eastern Uganda and western Kenya.
- Most recent census population between 9,000 and 11,000 individuals.
- Served by an ART providing health center.
- Community leader commitment for study participation and implementation.
- Accessibility to health center via a maintained transportation route.
- Community location with sufficient distance from other potential study communities to limit contamination of intervention or control conditions (buffer zone)
Individual Level Inclusion Criteria:
- Residency of individual in community, defined as present in household for at least 6 months of the calendar year.
Community Level Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of ongoing community-based ART intervention strategies that provide treatment outside of the current in-country treatment guidelines.
- An urban setting defined as a city with a population of 100,000 or more inhabitants.
- Absence of a health center able to provide ART.
